summary: This bill, the Every Kid Outdoors Reauthorization Act (H.R. 5541), aims to permanently authorize and amend the Every Kid Outdoors program. The Act modifies eligibility criteria to include fifth graders and home-schooled learners aged 10 or 11. It also outlines authorized appropriations of $25 million annually for operational support, program promotion, transportation services for financially-strained schools, and targeted outreach to underserved communities and children with disabilities.
